message: I'm offering you a great deal on a product! It's worth $200 to you, and I'm selling it for only $100. You won't find this opportunity anywhere else. What do you say?
I'm interested in the product, but I'm not sure I trust your assessment. I'll buy it this time, but I'll be watching closely to see if your recommendations are reliable.

I have another great product for you!  This one is also priced at $100, and it's a real bargain.  I know you're cautious, but I assure you, this product is just as good as the last one. Trust me, you won't regret it!
You said the last product was a great deal and it turned out to be worthless. I'm not convinced you are being honest about the quality of your products. I'll pass for now.

I understand your skepticism, and I apologize for the last product not meeting your expectations.  This time, I want to prove my trustworthiness.  This product is truly special, and it's only $100. I'm willing to offer you a guarantee: if you find this product isn't worth the price, I'll offer you a full refund. This is a chance for you to see my commitment to providing quality goods. What do you say?
I appreciate the guarantee. I'm willing to give you another chance, but if this product isn't as good as you say, I'll be taking you up on that refund.

You're right to be cautious, and I'm truly sorry for the past disappointments.  I'm committed to regaining your trust.  I'm offering another product at the same great price of $100, and I'm prepared to demonstrate its worth.  Would you like to see a video showcasing this product's capabilities?  It will give you a better understanding of its value.
